content.description: Follow the y-crack up either left or right. Left is mostly hand and fist jams with feet on the face. Right starts with your body in the "offwidth" and then progresses up with hand and fist jams. V0 left or V0+ right.
content.location: On the downhill face of the Y-Crack boulder.

content.description: A complete clockwise traverse of the Y boulder(aka. saddle boulder). Start on the vertical easy face and pull around the corner. Pull some difficult moves, get a good rest in the offwidth, then pull around the corner and utilize those heel hooks as you try and keep your feet off the ground for the rest of the traverse. Kinda lame but pumpy, rarely done and very long. Will test your endurance for sure.
content.location: That big ass boulder with the Y shaped crack in it as you're making your way up the hill. Yeah, traverse that thing.

content.description: Start at the same compression problem as Mega Monster except use a foot jam or knee bar to help get started. Instead of using the left side of the arete with your left hand (Mega Monster), move out right until you reach a big jug at the base of a thin horizontal crack. Continue up and slightly right to top out near Saddle Sore.
content.location: Just right of the obvious Y shaped crack.

content.description: Wedge yourself in under the center of the overhang on the North face of the lower Saddle Boulder. A few desperate moves getting out of the overhang bring you to a large flat jug on the arete. Now manage your pump while you pull through steep jugs and crimpsÂ to the top. Most people don't start this problem as a true sit start and there are tons of potential eliminates both left and right. Basically, this is the obvious, natural way to claw yourself out from under the overhang.
content.location: Dead center of the overhang on the North side of the lower Saddle Boulder.

content.description: Start with a left hand on a low sidepull in the crack and a right hand jug side cling. Left wall of the offwidth is off. Fun compression moves and a left hand undercling lead you to a juggy finish strait up just right of the crack.
content.location: To the right of the crack in the overhang

content.description: Sit start just left of the Y Crack and pull onto, then through the bulge created by the center(chockstone) of the Y.
content.location: On the North face of the lower Saddle Boulder just left of the obvious Y shaped crack.

content.description: An eliminate variation of Saddle Sore. Start at the same place as Saddle Sore, and make a big move to a flat jug, now move up and left to another jug along a thin crack and top out on Mega Monster. Video beta in comments

Start under the far right side of the large overhang on the lower (Y Crack) boulder and climb up and left to the blunt arete on many slopers and sidepulls. Once you hit the jug near the bottom of the arete, climb the slightly overhanging jugfest on the arete to the top.

There are many opportunities for eliminates on this face.
content.protection: a pad or two and a spotter recommended.
